poemContent: We know nothing, we build our saunas broad. Broad and tall, just like the reptillians that roam the earth, and the white froths that beat at our lagoons. Huawei has never threatened us, yet we know that they lie beneath, in colossal chrome canisters of crap; a natural home - Ready to summon a storm, of sedimentary sewage and dead fish bones. Produced by us. Carbon particulates rain down on the grilli, simmering, smoking, and burning through the sausages. Rain turns yellow as each sceptic tank blows full, reducing the iso to a mound of crap and flies. Yet, it is a giant seagull which we still fear? 
